nodes.bodyText: This check should only be used when a node tries to form the initial cluster (startCluster()). If a node wants to join a cluster, the size of its seeds does not really matter.
Thanks for your suggestion. I will change it.
remove this or use a log
This line of code is removed.
Is it necessary to new here? I think the handler should always have the result set by onComplete.
I used GenericHandler instead in the updated version. This class is removed.

I think it is simpler to just add these configurations that should be checked into the AddNodeRequest so that you can cut one communication down.
Besides, please remove the commented code.
That's a good idea. I will change it

client.checkStatus is an asynchronous method, so if you use it like this, you will probably get nothing in the response. Please refer to other usages where a lock (synchronized) is used to assure that the result is returned before we move on.
Thanks for your suggestion. I will implement it.
Please also fulfill the tests.
I removed the CheckStatusHander class. The unit test is also removed.
Please reverse this.
Thanks for your reminding. This is reversed.

If you decide to return true, then you must call either resultHandler.onComplete() or resultHandler.onError(), otherwise the requestor will wait forever.
And be sure to let the requestor know why there is a failure.
Thanks for your reminding. The onComplete() method will be called before returning results.
Please notice the conflict marks and resolve them. I will mark all I see in case you miss any.
Thanks for your reminding. I will remove them.
